facts: Mesopotamia was located within the Tigris–Euphrates river system, in modern days roughly corresponding to most of Iraq, Kuwait, the eastern parts of Syria, Southeastern Turkey, and regions along the Turkish–Syrian and Iran–Iraq borders.
Ancient Egypt was a civilization in Northeast Africa concentrated along the lower reaches of the Nile River, in what is now modern Egypt.
Ancient Greece was a civilization belonging to a period of Greek history from the Greek Dark Ages of the 12th–9th centuries BCE to the end of antiquity.
The Roman Empire was the post-Republican period of ancient Rome.
At its height under Trajan, the Roman Empire controlled approximately 6.5 million square kilometers of land surface.

definitions.definition: A complex form of writing used in Ancient Egypt

quotes: Mesopotamia is widely considered to be the cradle of civilization, where the earliest developments of human civilization occurred.
keyPoints: Mesopotamia was a region with significant early developments in civilization.
Key achievements of Mesopotamia include the development of writing (cuneiform), formation of cities, invention of the wheel and plow, and advancements in mathematics and astronomy.
Ancient Egypt is known for monumental architecture like pyramids and the Sphinx, hieroglyphic writing, complex religious beliefs, and advanced knowledge of medicine and astronomy.
Ancient Greece laid the foundations for Western civilization through concepts of democracy, philosophy, theatre, Olympic Games, and advances in science and mathematics.
The Roman Empire was characterized by extensive engineering achievements, a sophisticated legal system, vast military power, Latin language and literature, and urban planning.
